title: Condensed Serif?
content:
Hi, can anybody identify this condensed serif?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [P.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20100404152515/http:/typophile.com/files/P.png) | 25.46 KB |
author: M Dash

comments.content:
This is an odd font. Most narrow high contrast serifs I can find, like [Onyx](http://web.archive.org/web/20100404152515/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0004439), or [Ambroise](http://web.archive.org/web/20100404152515/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=CTT0000265), or [Bodoni Black Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20100404152515/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=RRT0011410) have all got ruled serifs. I suppose someone could have modified one of these (or similar) fonts to create a new font, so perhaps looking among the freebies would be worth doing. I searched 'narrow serifs' at both Veer and MyFonts and did not see anything closer than those I mentioned.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you very much for your help! I'll go hunting for narrow serifs over the Easter break then!

I checked the freebie serifs at Dafont, and the 'narrow serifs' at FontShop (keyword search there is not too helpful), but didn't find this in either site.

- Mike Yanega
